intro: Serissa kawakamii, commonly known as the Japanese serissa, is a flowering plant native to Japan and southern Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant has dense, evergreen foliage with small, rounded leaves that give it a compact, bushy appearance. It is often cultivated as a decorative shrub in gardens and as a potted plant due to its ornamental value. Serissa kawakamii thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for humid climates.
